item.title: Dice Dreams: Free Rolls For July 2025
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Dice Dreams Links For July 2025
  • How To Redeem Dice Links In Dice Dreams

From attacking opponents and collecting resources to upgrading your kingdom, Dice Dreams is a great option for everyone who enjoys board games with a competitive twist. As the name implies, the core mechanic of Dice Dreams revolves around rolling dice to determine movement and actions on the board.

If you feel like your dice supply is running low, you can use dice links to get free rolls in Dice Dreams . With these free rolls, you can continue rolling the dice to build your kingdom, collect resources, and compete with other players to become the true Dice King.

Updated July 7, 2025, by Usama Ali: Dice Dreams is all about luck, strategy, and building your dream kingdom, one dice roll at a time. Each roll can earn you coins, trigger attacks, or help you steal from other players, making every move exciting. If you're running low on dice, you can use free Dice Dreams links. This guide is regularly updated with the latest links, so you can grab bonus rolls and rewards without hassle. These special links don’t last long, so make sure to check back daily to claim them before they expire.

We added 11 new links today.

Dice Dreams Links For July 2025

Like most board games, the developers of Dice Dreams regularly introduce dice links for players running low on dice. These links can be helpful in continuing your progress and can be used to redeem various rewards, including rolls and Building Blitz, which can consequently help you build your kingdom. Moreover, these links occasionally reward millions of coins, but most of the time, you'll receive rolls. Below is a list of active links that Dice Dreams players can use to earn some free goodies.

These links are only active for a limited time period, so make sure to redeem them before they expire.

In addition to redeeming rewards from these links, you can earn rolls in Dice Dreams through various other methods. These include regularly participating in events, inviting friends to the game, and taking advantage of in-game promotions and offers. While spending real money is not recommended, you can invite new players or link your Facebook account to get rolls for free.

Expired Dice Dream Links

Like most mobile games, Dice Dreams links expire quickly, usually within a day or so. Recently, there’s been a noticeable shift in the frequency of these link releases, and developers have reduced their quantity. As such, it’s uncertain how long the links will remain active moving forward. For your convenience, here are some expired Dice Dreams links:

How To Redeem Dice Links In Dice Dreams

To redeem a link in Dice Dreams for its reward, you'll first have to click on the links mentioned above. These links will redirect you to another page where you'll see "Get." Click on that, and you'll be redirected to your game, where you'll receive the respective rewards instantly.

You need to have the Dice Dreams app installed before clicking on the link, or else the links and "Get" button will not work.

Make sure to only click on dice links from trustworthy sources to avoid malware or data leakage issues. The links included here have been tried and tested to ensure players don't run into any problems.

item.title: Date Everything: Beau Romance Guide
item.description:
Beau is dateable #87 in Date Everything and loves nothing more than going on an adventure to find some hidden treasure. In other words, she's based on Indiana Jones. They're a pretty fun character to interact with, but depending on how engaged you are with the gameplay, you might find she talks a little bit too much. Fortunately, there is a way to get the 'Love' and 'Friends' endings with Beau much faster than the ordinary way in Date Everything , and I'll explain how to do just that, as well as how to get her hate ending and where to find her in this guide.

Where to Find Beau in Date Everything

Found Throughout the House

Beau can be found in multiple locations throughout the house as cardboard boxes . These are typically found in closets or cupboards, but can also be found in the attic (if you have the skeleton key).

The easiest place to find her is in the closet in your bedroom. Open the one on the right (when facing away from your bed) and use your Dateviators on the boxes that don't contain decorations in the far corner (that's Holly).

How to Romance Beau in Date Everything

Beau loves embarking on an adventure, so the main thing you need to do is make sure that you're willing to join her whenever she invites you. Just generally be enthusiastic about her interests, and you'll reach the all-important dialogue check after a few interactions.

To help you out, I've included the dialogue options I chose to get me the 'Love' ending with Beau. Keep in mind that some of these dialogue options may not be as important as others in terms of reaching the 'Love' ending, but these are the ones I've verified work.

First Interaction

  • Popcorn?
  • You kinda look like you're about to go on safari!
  • Did you just say wink, while you were winking?
  • Onward! What's the quest? I'm in.
  • Who do you think I am?
  • The leading what?
  • Yeah, I am but I didn't build it or anything.
  • Nope. I just live here.
  • Oh crap, are you gonna be sick??

Second Interaction

  • What's in it for me?
  • Now you put it that way... hell yes, I do. Let's GO!
  • Jacques?
  • Sure, in a manner of speaking.
  • Why do we have to deal with Jacques?
  • Did you try to steal his sword?
  • Steal it.
  • Can't deny that. Ok. Let's go get a sword.

Third Interaction

This one involves you going and interacting with the pirate ship in the glass bottle on the mantelpiece in the living room by the sofa. This is also near where you can find the dust bunny.

  • So that Jacques doesn't hear us?
  • I get it I get it, I'm ready! Let's go!
  • Oh my god, this is so cool, it's just like yours!
  • Lead on, then! What's the next step?
  • So we don't even know what this thing looks like?
  • Hey! Hey everyone, let's just calm down...
  • Beau, your whole outfit is made out of recycled cardboard.
  • Guys! Come ON! Get it together and let's just talk!
  • Ok THAT'S IT. ENOUGH.
  • No.
  • Beau, why don't you tell us why the sword is so important?
  • Jacques, you know about this legend too? It's not just a Beau thing?
  • Oh, Beau, this is personal for you, huh?
  • Follow you where?
  • And... then?
  • Oh, my god.
  • I recognize that.
  • Yeah. I... made it. When I was a kid.
  • Yeah. With a bejeweling kit.
  • You two are agreeing. That's... good progress!
  • Ha! Of course! Love it!
  • It seems this quest is bigger than both of you.

Fourth Interaction

This fourth interaction sees you, Beau, and Jacques carrying on the quest by interacting with some cardboard boxes in the bedroom closet again.

In this interaction, Gaia will appear and essentially ask if you'd like to skip the 'quest' with Jacques and Beau. By doing so, you'll have a handful of final dialogue options to choose from with Beau and can still get the 'Love' ending as long as you've been following along up until this point. I did the 'shortcut', and so the dialogue options below are based on this. This does not prevent you from unlocking Rongomaiwhenua, either.

  • I have zero questions about this. I'm in no matter what!
  • Is she as pretty as you?
  • Thank you for including me in something so important.
  • I am! Where is Jacques, though?
  • Beau, what are you doing...?
  • Hi Gaia, it's nice to meet you! I hope you're ready...
  • I'm glad you're here, Gaia.
  • Sure...?
  • How long are we talking?
  • Yeah, that sounds like too much for me. Summary please! (This option will be the 'shortcut' and bring you to the end of the quest)
  • That was pretty helpful!

Fifth Interaction

  • Yeah, I missed ya.
  • I wanted to thank you for the adventure. I needed that.
  • It is!
  • I was looking for love, actually...
  • I was trying to flirt, but you wouldn't let me!
  • I am... for your heart.

How to Get Beau's Friend and Hate Endings in Date Everything

Beau's other two endings are pretty easy to get, as they simply require one different dialogue option in the fifth interaction, or just refusing to spend time with her in general. I've outlined each of these points below.

Friends

To be friends with Beau, players must choose the 'Oh yeah. I think so.' dialogue option when she asks if it's say to call each other "friend" for real now . This will pivot the above dialogue choices for the 'Love' ending and get you the 'Friends' ending instead.

Hate

If you want Beau to hate you, simply refuse to go on adventures with her whenever she asks you . This will result in her eventually giving up on her quest with you and get you the 'Hate' ending.

If you get Beau's 'hate' ending, it's impossible to find and interact with Rongomaiwhenua, who is dateable #59. As such, I strongly recommend not getting Beau's hate ending, unless you use a Candy to quest with her again afterwards.

How to Realize Beau in Date Everything

Get Grinding Poise

Once you've romanced 10 characters in Date Everything , you'll have the ability to realize them as real human beings. Each character has their own specific SPECS stats requirements in order to be realized, however. For Beau, these are:

SPECS Stat

Requirement

Smarts

60

Poise

90

Empathy

Charm

70

Sass

30

Once you realize Beau, she'll leave the house forever, and you won't be able to talk to her again. Make sure you're ready to say goodbye before you do so.

8 Images
8 Images

item.title: Date Everything: Rongomaiwhenua Romance Guide
item.description:
Rongomaiwhenua is dateable #59 in Date Everything and, unlike the majority of characters in the game, requires you to meet some unlock requirements to be able to interact with and eventually romance her. In this guide, I'll run through the unlock requirements, how to get her romance, 'friends', and 'hate' endings, and what SPECS stats you'll need to realize her in Date Everything . So, without further ado, let's dive into it.

Where to Find Rongomaiwhenua in Date Everything

Tracking Down Dateable #59

Rongomaiwhenua must first be unlocked by completing Beau's questline. You need to go ahead and do all of her 'quests' (which include Jacques), but you can take Gaia up on her option to skip the second part and get a summary if you don't want to sit through it. By completing this quest, they'll uncover Rongomaiwhenua, who is then available to speak to on her own in the house.

Rongomaiwhenua is the geode that sits on the shelf in your office after completing the quest with Beau .

How to Romance Rongomaiwhenua in Date Everything

Rongomaiwhenua is a goddess, and so it should come as no surprise that she likes to be worshipped and truly appreciated for all her grace and power. This also means that she's very easy to keep happy. To ensure you don't take a wrong step, I've included all the dialogue options I chose during each interaction to guarantee a 'Love' ending below.

First Interaction

  • New?
  • I don't think I'm immortal...
  • Can I just call you Ro?
  • Happy to help.

Second Interaction

  • Sure have.
  • Well you ARE very pretty...
  • You can get my worship anytime baby.
  • I was hoping to get to know you.
  • I've never known anyone as powerful or beautiful as you.
  • I really do want to get to know you.

Third Interaction

  • You've been waiting for me?
  • What did they say exactly?
  • I live to serve, queen.
  • I just want to be happy honestly.
  • Going to try to advance my relationships.

Fourth Interaction

  • Are you saying what I think you're saying?
  • Sounds good.

How to Get Rongomaiwhenua's Friends and Hate Endings in Date Everything

Rongomaiwhenua is one of the simplest characters to get all the endings for, because of the lack of a proper 'questline' in your interactions with her. Instead, you can get whichever ending you want by adjusting how you speak with her and whether you agree to 'worship' her as she so desperately craves. I've explained the process you need to take for the friends and hate endings below.

Friends

To become friends with Rongomaiwhenua, you need to select the 'Can we just be friends?' dialogue option when she asks, "Would you like to experience infinity, human?" By doing so, she'll agree to just be friends, rather than romantic companions.

Hate

To make Rongomaiwhenua hate you, you just need to refuse to worship her, call her delusional and just generally be rude . She'll be offended that you're not treating her like the goddess she thinks she is, and will quickly learn to hate you.

If you get Rongomaiwhenua's 'Hate' ending, you can always use a candy to start over and get one of the other two endings instead.

How to Realize Rongomaiwhenua in Date Everything

You'll unlock the ability to realize characters after you have romanced 10 of them. Realizing turns the character into a human so they can leave the house and truly experience the world. Each character has SPECS stats requirements, and you must have reached either a 'Friends' or 'Love' ending with them to be realized. For Rongomaiwhenua, these are:

SPECS Stat

Requirement

Smarts

80

Poise

70

Empathy

60

Charm

40

Sass

Once you choose to realize a character, they'll leave the house, and you won't be able to speak to them again.
